abstract: The state's Blue Shield said it had pledged to cap profits at 2 percent.
snippet: The state's Blue Shield said it had pledged to cap profits at 2 percent.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

lead_paragraph: Blue Shield of California, a large nonprofit health insurer based in San Francisco, said on Thursday that it planned to return an additional $295 million to its customers as part of the pledge it made earlier this year to cap its earnings to 2 percent of its revenue.

headline.main: California Health Insurer Will Issue Refunds
